title: Does Tik Tok (TikTok) pay people to make videos similarly to how YouTube does? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tik-tok and youtube both are social media plateform of video streaming but there are some differences between them. YOutube allow users to upload any duration of video and audience of youtube also love to watch long duration knowledgeable videos but tik-tok is known for short and funny videos which give quick goosebumps to viewers. Ok there is a big question which many tik tokers want to know that” why tik tok doesn’t play ads like youtube ? tik tok is a short entertainment video plateform so if they start play ads in videos it may effect their viewer and it will disturb viewer’s attention to the video and will make the videos less entertaing . Let’s talk about creators-”How they can earn money on tik-tok ?” To earn money on tik tok the main thing you need is your followers when you get some followers the brands will contact you and ask you for their sponsorship and they will pay you for this .This is the only way to earn money on tik tok.

The common way for short-video platforms like Douyin (TikTok) to seek for appropriate content creators is through MCN, which contracts with a number of quality content producers and online influencers. According to the standard from Weishi, a short-video App owned by Tencent, there are three ranking of videos, S, A and B. The video that receives over 50 Likes and 1000 Views can be ranked B-level; those with over 400 and 3500 Likes within 120 hours are respectively included to the A and S grade. The subsidy for each rank is RMB150, RMB 500 and RMB 1500. I think TikTok’s strategy to attract short-video talent and enthusiast basically works similarly, but given that Weishi is still in an aggressive promotion period to grab the market share, TikTok’s investment in content building will be relatively smaller, namely it may not pay the content author as much as Weishi does.
